lead: This week in tech innovation: OpenAI welcomes a new talent, while the Pentagon grapples with AI usage policies amid rising tensions in the tech landscape.

stories.title: OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger joins OpenAI
stories.summary: Peter Steinberger, the creator of OpenClaw, has joined OpenAI, where he will continue to support the project as it transitions to open source. This move reflects OpenAI's commitment to fostering innovation and collaboration in AI development.

stories.title: Anthropic and the Pentagon are reportedly arguing over Claude usage
stories.summary: Tensions rise between Anthropic and the Pentagon over the use of Claude, an AI model, for potential mass surveillance and autonomous weapons. This debate highlights the ethical implications of AI in military applications.

stories.title: Woolworths splits infosec and physical security again
stories.summary: Woolworths has restructured its security operations, separating information security from physical security, signaling a strategic shift in how the Australian retail giant manages its security protocols.

stories.title: India has 100M weekly active ChatGPT users, Sam Altman says
stories.summary: OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman revealed that India boasts the largest number of weekly active ChatGPT users globally, showcasing the rapid adoption of AI technologies in the region.

stories.title: Tesla CarPlay is coming but it's reportedly being held back by low iOS 26 adoption numbers
stories.summary: Tesla's anticipated integration of Apple CarPlay is facing delays due to low adoption rates of iOS 26. This situation underscores the challenges of tech compatibility in the evolving automotive landscape.

stories.title: The enterprise AI land grab is on. Glean is building the layer beneath the interface.
stories.summary: Glean is pivoting from an enterprise search tool to a middleware layer for enterprise AI, highlighting the competitive landscape of AI solutions in business environments.

stories.title: The official Pokémon pinball machine has an animatronic Pikachu and a Master Ball plunger
stories.summary: Stern Pinball has launched an official Pokémon pinball machine featuring an animatronic Pikachu and various nostalgic elements, blending gaming and technology for a unique entertainment experience.

stories.title: Astronauts Are Now Allowed to Use the Latest Smartphones in Space
stories.summary: NASA has approved the use of the latest smartphones for astronauts in upcoming missions, allowing them to capture images and communicate more effectively during space exploration.

stories.title: Apple may be adding a splash of color to its upcoming budget-friendly MacBook
stories.summary: Apple is reportedly testing vibrant color options for its next budget-friendly MacBook, aimed at students and enterprise users, indicating a shift towards more personalized tech products.
